trans-unit.source: Provides statistical data for a network interface on the local computer.
This class is used by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface.GetIPv4Statistics%2A> method to return network traffic information for an interface.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv4InterfaceStatistics"></xref> class.
This constructor can be called only by classes that derive from <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv4InterfaceStatistics>.
Gets the number of bytes that were received on the interface.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of bytes that were received on the interface.
Gets the number of bytes that were sent on the interface.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of bytes that were transmitted on the interface.
Gets the number of incoming packets that were discarded.
This data does not include packets with errors.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of discarded incoming packets.
Gets the number of incoming packets with errors.
This data does not include packets without errors that were discarded.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of incoming packets with errors.
Gets the number of incoming packets with an unknown protocol that were received on the interface.
This data reflects packets that were discarded because the protocol identifier in the packet header was not recognized.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of incoming packets with an unknown protocol.
Gets the number of non-unicast packets that were received on the interface.
Packets with unicast addresses are delivered to a single interface.
Packets with non-unicast addresses can be delivered to multiple interfaces.
Anycast, broadcast, and multicast addresses are types of non-unicast addresses.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of non-unicast packets that were received on the interface.
Gets the number of non-unicast packets that were sent on the interface.
Packets with unicast addresses are delivered to a single interface.
Packets with non-unicast addresses can be delivered to multiple interfaces.
Anycast, broadcast, and multicast addresses are types of non-unicast addresses.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of non-unicast packets that were sent on the interface.
Gets the number of outgoing packets that were discarded.
This data does not include outgoing packets with errors.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of discarded outgoing packets.
Gets the number of outgoing packets with errors.
This data does not include packets without errors that were discarded.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of outgoing packets with errors.
Gets the length of the output queue.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of packets in the output queue.
Gets the number of unicast packets that were received on the interface.
Packets with unicast addresses are delivered to a single interface.
Packets with non-unicast addresses can be delivered to multiple interfaces.
Anycast, broadcast, and multicast addresses are types of non-unicast addresses.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of unicast packets that were received on the interface.
Gets the number of unicast packets that were sent on the interface.
Packets with unicast addresses are delivered to a single interface.
Packets with non-unicast addresses can be delivered to multiple interfaces.
Anycast, broadcast, and multicast addresses are types of non-unicast addresses.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of unicast packets that were sent on the interface.
